intro: Ribes sinanense f. inerme, commonly known as the smooth gooseberry, is a shrub native to eastern Asia, particularly China. It belongs to the genus Ribes in the family Grossulariaceae, which includes other species of gooseberries and currants. The plant is characterized by its smooth, glabrous stems and small, often yellow or orange berries. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks. The smooth, hairless leaves and berries distinguish it from other members of the genus.
